metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23971 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When processing a redirect with a conflicting Referrer-Policy, Firefox would have adopted the redirect's Referrer-Policy. This would have potentially resulted in more information than intended by the original origin being provided to the destination of the redirect. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 86.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23971` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 86.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
